articles.title: Millions in China due to return to work despite coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Many factories and offices in China have been ordered to stagger their working hours to limit the number of people in public places. Also: Sinn Fein to try to form governing coalition after Irish election success, and the renowned opera singer Mirella Freni h…
articles.content: Many factories and offices in China have been ordered to stagger their working hours to limit the number of people in public places. Also: Sinn Fein to try to form governing coalition after Irish election success, and the renowned opera singer Mirella Freni h… [+33 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Amazon pulls out of Barcelona tech show
articles.description: The company is the latest firm to withdraw from Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty Images
Amazon is the latest major company to pull out of one of the world's largest tech shows because of risks posed by coronavirus.
Amazon said "due to the outbreak and continued concerns about the new coronavirus" it would no longer … [+1699 chars]

articles.title: Millions expected to return to work in China despite virus
articles.description: Millions of people in China are about to go back to work after the Lunar New Year break, which was extended to try to curb the spread of the coronavirus. We hear from the Chinese Ambassador to the UK, an expert on Asian economics and a US citizen who has chos…
articles.content: Millions of people in China are about to go back to work after the Lunar New Year break, which was extended to try to curb the spread of the coronavirus. We hear from the Chinese Ambassador to the UK, an expert on Asian economics and a US citizen who has chos… [+434 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus deaths exceed Sars fatalities
articles.description: The coronoavirus outbreak that began in China has now killed more than eight hundred people - surpassing the number killed by SARS nearly twenty years ago. Also in the programme: Counting begins in Irish general election; and what to watch out at the Oscars. …
articles.content:
The coronoavirus outbreak that began in China has now killed more than eight hundred people - surpassing the number killed by SARS nearly twenty years ago.
Also in the programme: Counting begins in Irish general election; and what to watch out at the Oscars.… [+111 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Thousands on cruise ship allowed to disembark after tests
articles.description: Some 3,600 people can finally disembark in Hong Kong after tests for coronavirus return negative.
articles.content:
Image copyrightEPAImage caption
 Passengers have been allowed to disembark the World Dream cruise ship
Thousands of people stuck on a cruise ship in Hong Kong for five days have been allowed to disembark after tests for coronavirus came back negative.
Some… [+3517 chars]

articles.title: Scotland's papers: Call for Mackay investigation and virus warning
articles.description: An MSP calls for ex-finance secretary to be investigated by child protection body and coronavirus fears make the papers.
articles.content: Travel disruption as Storm Ciara hits UKAir, rail, roads and ferries are hit by severe gales and heavy rain across the country.

articles.title: Coronavirus: Final rescue flight from Wuhan due back in UK
articles.description: More than 200 people are on board and will be taken into quarantine in Milton Keynes for 14 days.
articles.content:
Image copyrightPA MediaImage caption
 The flight is the third to evacuate people to the UK from the centre of the coronavirus outbreak
More than 200 people evacuated from the coronavirus-hit city of Wuhan is due to land at RAF Brize Norton within hours.
Th… [+3321 chars]

articles.title: Thai soldier kills many people in shooting rampage
articles.description: Thai security forces rescued hundreds of people from a shopping centre while searching for the gunman. Also: WHO says the number of new coronavirus cases has stabilised in Hubei province, and "lightning strike" kills rare mountain gorillas in Uganda.
articles.content: Thai security forces rescued hundreds of people from a shopping centre while searching for the gunman. Also: WHO says the number of new coronavirus cases has stabilised in Hubei province, and "lightning strike" kills rare mountain gorillas in Uganda.
